captions.text: Before I had any idea what sex was, I thought it was some kind of secret club that only had a couple members, including my parents and some movie stars.
I knew it involved my vagina but I didn't really know what a penis was.
I really didn't understand how it inserted so I felt like they just kind of laid on top of each other and things just happened.
I actually would make my Barbie's do this. I would make Ken kiss Barbie's vagina. I was sure that was something adults did.
And I didn't understand which hole, not until high school did I find out that a girl has three holes. I just didn't really think about it... It's a weird thing to think about.
If you put coke up your vagina after having unprotected sex you wouldn't get pregnant, also if you had sex standing up you couldn't get pregnant.
There was like the Catholic myth that if you masturbate you go blind and I once had a theology teacher who said that in class and then looked directly at a girl with glasses.
In sex ed I had to do a report on scabies so I grew up thinking that that was a real threat in the world of penises I would encounter but so far, no scabies.
When I was about thirteen I had a tape dedicated to Sarah Michelle Gellar interviews, when I went to go watch that tape once, my brother had taped over half of it with porn.
I was eight years old and my dad left a basket of Girls Gone Wild videos next to his nightstand.
I went to a birthday sleepover and the birthday girl had come across this porn video, like 'guys I have this big surprise'
and she turned it on and it was some woman interrogating this man and she had very large breasts.
I didn't like find it or stumble upon it, I downloaded the R. Kelly porn video. It was like road kill, you're just like 'no, no, mmm, no.'
But it got me excited. Then he peed on people, that wasn't the one that I watched.
She came into the room, she like locked me in a room with a slideshow of STD's and was just like, this is what will happen if you have sex you will get all of these, don't do it your body's a temple.
We were watching some movie where a girl comes to age and asks her mom the birds and the bees.

and so I turned my mom like, 'hey are you ever gonna explain the birds and the bees to me and she goes 'are you having sex tomorrow?' And I was like 'no' and she's like 'then no' and then walked away.
That was the only sex talk I've ever had with my mom.
Kids aren't necessarily aware of the act of sex but kids are aware of the sexy stuff pretty young, I mean look at any Disney video. Everyone's breasts are heaving and men are just like thrusting.
It's like very sexually awakening.

title: Girls' Misconceptions about Sex (When They Were Younger)
